content: hey DM crafters welcome to the dam's craft I'm DM Scotty good to have you
with me today we're going to do a tile that has been frozen over I have had a
lot of people do snow or frozen tiles on my forum which you can see down in the
description the link for the forum love we'd love to have you get some great
ideas out there but anyways we've done tiles we've done lava tiles we've done
tiles filled with water and other types of things on tiles but I thought today I
would show you a frozen area that I'm doing in what am I in mana like a
caverns so full different than the technique I've seen on my website so
let's go the table I'll show you that now
here are a pretty standard cave tile now what I want to do with this tile is
something different I want to make it look like a cracked ice floor kind of
thing so what I've done is I've done the tile on the regular cardboard then I
grabbed some thin cardstock and I traced it onto the cardstock cut it out and
then I'm going to put it on top of this now you can see I've got kind of like a
puzzle pieces here and I've got them numbered this way I can easily put this
puzzle back together so I because I know where that pieces go so I've drawn some
thick lines so what I'm going to do is cut this out but I'm not going to cut in
the center the line I'm going to cut at the edge so there will be a little bit
of space between each piece and that will give an interesting effect on the
floor so what I'll do is I will cut this out then I'll glue each piece to the
tile and then once I do that I will grab my cave edges and I always do them a
little long so I can cut off the ends and then I'll glue those on and that way
I won't have to worry about cutting exactly to the edge I can just put this
right on there and it'll it'll fit perfectly so there we go what I'll do is
I'll cut these out and apply them and then of what I'm going to do is I'm
going to paint the cave I'll paint the cave the basic color and then we'll come
back and do some painting on it so here is our tile all assembled with
the pieces I decided to add a little bit of extra texture to this so I just kind
of drove the glue gun head over the pieces and made some lines I just
thought it'd be a little more interesting texture on there to do that
so I went ahead and did that so I want to show you that before I painted it and
then you can see kind of like a jigsaw puzzle I've got all the pieces on here
and then I put the the walls on there and and completed the tile so now we
will go paint it and then we'll start detailing
here's our tile and all that detail is kind of lost within the texture paint
but once we add somewhere paint on here it'll start to pop out again so what I'm
going to do is I'm going to grab a large brush water down my white quite a bit
and then just start putting it in here you can see some of that texture is
starting to pop out again but we'll look we'll get some more of that out of there
this is just our start coat all right so we'll let that dry and then we'll move
on to the next step now I'm going to use a pool blue on this
tile so I'm gonna wet it down like I have the others and I'm just gonna kind
of drag willy-nilly trusts the tile but I'm also going to kind of follow the
fractures of the tile so I'm gonna all right so I've got the fractures of
the tile and I'll do a few little more flicks
all right now we'll let that dry and we're on to the next phase
here what I'm gonna do is now that my blue is right I'm gonna put some more a
white highlight on there and I'm gonna kind of get the edges of the ice there
where the cracks were I'm also gonna do the edge of the wall like the Chamber is
frozen which is essentially that's what's happened
so now what I want to do is I'm going to let this dry and I'm going to add one
last step to to give this put this over the top and really make it really look
nice I'll let this dry and then won't come back with that
one last thing I'm gonna do to make this tile look really icy is I'm going to use
some pearlescent paint it's just kind of a white paint that it has pearlescent
it's very translucent I use a very watery and but it gives it a nice Sheen
to this to the surface so I'm just gonna start putting that down enough you'll be
able to see that but there we go there's a nice detail of the ice though so you
can kind of see that shimmering in the light as I rotate it there so part of it
is this wet though so but it will retain that kind of wet wetness so I'm going to
do one last thing to this and then we'll be all finished
you have the last stage of our project I'm going to use my water-based varnish
and slop it on there give it a nice Sheen and that'll really help bring the
ice like tendencies out on this I'm gonna make it look like some ice
now there's one last thing we can do to put this over the top and this will be a
really neat effect what I'm going to do is I'm going to sprinkle some glitter on
this but I'm not going to use the standard kind of glitter you think of
like the the big silver flakes of glitter that'll just look like big
flakes with glitter so what I'm going to use is this stuff it's a little more
refined you can get at the craft store it's called fairy sparkle okay and this
is a much finer kind of glitter so I'll just start sprinkling it on there and
you may be able to see it in the camera may not know need to much
all right so there that the water-based varnish will help keep it on the tile
and once that dries up you'll be able to see how nice that Sparkle is I'll give
you a look at it so we'll let that dry and then I'll show you what it looks
like here you can see our Finnish frozen tile
and we have our character standing on it looks really good
these characters are flocked and I've had people say oh you know if you flock
a character you know it doesn't fit with the training it'll look weird well you
know I mean it's to me it still looks better than if it's not flocked but you
know you're not gonna be able to flock a character for every situation I kind of
do like that ground with some rocks on it and that seems to be a pretty good
fit pretty well everywhere except for maybe something like this where it's
snow but you know it's not that distracting it's not really anymore to
me it's not any more distracting it would be if they had black bases but
anyways we'll move beyond that so I did do some shadow on the wall here like I
did on a normal tile and I'm gonna take the figures off and I want you to I want
to see if you can see the glitter that's on there so I've got that nice coat of
gloss water-based gloss on there and then I'll move it so you can see that
glitter that's embedded in that so it really gives it a nice icy texture look
so there we go there is a frozen area you can do on
your tiles and I'll see you next time on the dm's crap hey guys if you're really
digging these videos and would like some more information or to talk to other
crafters look at the link below in the description and you can join my forum on
the dams craft we'd love to have you and I'll see you there
you
